keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Sheikha Aldosary from Riyadh.

lead_paragraph: The attack on Shiites during midday Friday Prayer left at least 21 people dead, and some Saudis on social media rushed to blame Iran.

headline.print_headline: Islamic State Says It Was Behind Suicide Bombing at Saudi Mosque That Killed 21
headline.main: ISIS Claims Responsibility for Bombing at Saudi Mosque

snippet: The attack on Shiites during midday Friday Prayer left at least 21 people dead, and some Saudis on social media rushed to blame Iran.
abstract: Islamic State claims responsibility for suicide bombing of Shiite mosque in eastern Saudi Arabia that is said to have killed at least 21 people and injured 120 others; attack points to possibility that Saudi air campaign against Houthis in Yemen may be escalating sectarian tensions at home.
